updates.news:
Here is a summary of recent announcements, news, contracts, projects, and investments in quantum tech, drone tech, robotics, space tech, satellite communication, nuclear energy, AI, and innovative technologies.

### I. Announcements, News, Contracts, Projects, or Rumors by USA Governments, DOD, DOE, NASA, or Similar Organizations

**Artificial Intelligence (AI)**
*   The White House operationalized its AI action plan in February 2026, introducing export-ready "American AI stack" packages, a U.S. Tech Corps, and new standards initiatives aimed at cementing America's dominance in the global AI race. This includes a new Peace Corps initiative to dispatch volunteer technologists to assist partner governments with AI deployment and the National Champions Initiative to integrate leading AI firms from partner countries into customized export stacks built around U.S. components.
*   The U.S. Department of the Treasury concluded a major public-private initiative in February 2026 to strengthen cybersecurity and risk management for AI in the financial services sector. A series of six resources developed with industry and federal/state regulatory partners will be released throughout February 2026 to enable secure and resilient AI across the U.S. financial system.
*   The CISA's Roadmap for AI, initiated in August 2023, guides the U.S. government's efforts to defend critical infrastructure and government networks against AI-based software system risks.
*   The National Science Foundation allocated $140 million in May 2023 to launch seven new National AI Research Institutes to promote responsible innovation and bolster the U.S.'s AI research and development (R&D) infrastructure.
*   The Trump administration's "Removing Barriers to American Leadership in Artificial Intelligence" (January 2025) and "Winning the AI Race: America's AI Action Plan" (July 2025) focus on an "innovation-first" approach to secure U.S. global AI dominance.
*   Legislation like the National Artificial Intelligence Initiative (NAII) Act of 2020 and the AI in Government Act of 2020 promote and fund AI innovation across federal agencies.

**Nuclear Energy**
*   The Department of Energy (DOE) announced up to $800 million in cost-sharing funding in December 2025 to accelerate the development and deployment of small modular reactors (SMRs), awarding funds to TVA and Holtec. TVA will build GE Vernova / Hitachi BWRX-300 reactors at its Clinch River site, and Holtec will deploy its SMR-300 units at the Palisades plant in Michigan.
*   In November 2025, DOE announced the financial close of a $1 billion loan to Constellation to help finance the Crane Clean Energy Center Restart project, a nuclear power plant in Pennsylvania.
*   The U.S. Government established a strategic partnership with Cameco Corporation and Brookfield Asset Management in October 2025 to accelerate the development of Westinghouse's nuclear reactor technologies.
*   The DOE also selected 11 initial projects for President Trump's Nuclear Reactor Pilot Program in August 2025, aiming for these advanced SMR technologies to achieve criticality by mid-2026. The program supports expedited licensing and permitting, rather than direct funding.
*   Deep Fission secured $80 million on February 19, 2026, to fast-track the commercialization of subterranean nuclear reactor technology.
*   Oklo secured an agreement on February 17, 2026, for 1.2 GW advanced nuclear energy development in southern Ohio.

**Space Tech & Satellite Communication**
*   Elon Musk's rocket venture, SpaceX, announced on February 2, 2026, that it had acquired xAI, merging his space exploration and artificial intelligence ventures into a single company. This combined entity is valued at $1.25 trillion and is expected to pursue a massive initial public offering later this year.
*   The merger aims to build "orbital data centers" composed of satellites launched by SpaceX, utilizing xAI's technology to meet AI data center demand. SpaceX filed an application with the Federal Communications Commission last month for an "orbital data center system" that includes launching 1 million satellites into Earth's orbit. Musk anticipates that within 2 to 3 years, space-based AI will be the most cost-effective way to generate AI compute.

### II. Investments by Magnificent 7 Companies or Prominent Investors

**Microsoft (AI)**
*   Microsoft unveiled approximately $23 billion in new AI investments on December 9, 2025, with a significant portion ($17.5 billion) directed towards building out AI infrastructure in India. This investment aims to establish Microsoft's largest cloud presence in India, with the first new data center going live mid-2026.
*   The company is also investing over $5.42 billion in Canada over the next two years, with total estimated investment amounting to C$19 billion (S$17.8 billion) between 2023 and 2027. This includes expanding its Azure Local cloud offering and partnering with Canadian AI startup Cohere.
*   Microsoft announced in February 2026 that it is on pace to invest $50 billion by the end of the decade in the Global South to build AI infrastructure, teach AI skills, expand multilingual and multicultural AI, and enable local AI innovations.
*   On February 26, 2026, Microsoft expanded its AI partnership with the University of Washington, providing increased access to advanced computing, strengthening applied research collaboration, and launching new workforce-focused learning initiatives.

**Tesla (AI, Robotics, Energy)**
*   Tesla disclosed a $2 billion investment in Elon Musk's AI startup, xAI, as part of a $20 billion funding round in its fourth-quarter 2025 earnings release (February 2026). This investment deepens Tesla's AI strategy, with plans to integrate xAI's Grok large language model into its Full Self-Driving (FSD) software and Optimus robots.
*   Globally, Tesla's capital expenditure is projected to exceed $20 billion in 2026, focusing on AI computing power, robotic factories, mass production of the Cybercab, and energy storage. Tesla also plans to increase investments in AI hardware and software, and the energy sector in China this year.

**Amazon (Drone Tech)**
*   On February 10, 2026, Amazon announced the addition of two new Prime Air drone delivery centers near Chicago, bringing its nationwide total to ten facilities. These centers aim to create about 100 new jobs.
*   Amazon also acquired a 5.3% stake in the electric aviation firm BETA Technologies, signaling investment in future logistics technologies.
*   As of February 2025, Amazon Prime Air had expanded its drone delivery program to 10 major U.S. cities, serving approximately 500,000 households.

**Meta Platforms (AI)**
*   Meta plans to invest over $600 billion by 2028 to construct "gigawatt-plus" scale campuses across multiple U.S. states, including Louisiana, Texas, Wisconsin, and Wyoming, for hyperscale AI data centers. The first multi-gigawatt AI data center, named Prometheus Hyperscale, is expected to become operational in Ohio in 2026.
*   Meta agreed to a multi-year AI hardware partnership with AMD, valued at over $100 billion, to build out up to 6 gigawatts of AMD's Instinct GPUs for its growing AI workloads (February 2026). This deal aims to diversify Meta's chip supplies beyond Nvidia.
*   Meta has also separately struck a deal with Nvidia to buy millions of AI chips and plans to nearly double its spending on AI infrastructure to up to $135 billion in the current year.
*   The company is advancing the construction of a gigantic data center, the "Hyperion" project, in Holly Ridge, Louisiana, with an investment volume of approximately $30 billion.

**Nvidia (AI)**
*   Nvidia acquired Israeli AI startup Illumex for approximately $60 million in February 2026. Illumex developed a platform called Generative Semantic Fabric (GSF) that converts organizational knowledge into AI-ready semantic ontologies for enterprise AI applications.
*   Nvidia is nearing completion of a $30 billion equity investment in OpenAI, reported on February 20, 2026, as part of OpenAI's ongoing fundraising effort. This investment marks a shift from a previous hardware supply pact to direct ownership, with OpenAI planning to use the capital to acquire Nvidia's GPUs.
*   The acquisition of Advizex by Myriad360 on February 23, 2026, created a "global Nvidia AI platform powerhouse" with $900 million in annual gross revenue, focusing on Nvidia AI platform solutions.

**Peter Thiel (Prominent Investor)**
*   Peter Thiel's hedge fund, Thiel Macro, liquidated its entire stake in Nvidia in the third quarter of 2025 (approximately $100 million) and trimmed its Tesla position by 76% in the same quarter.
*   During Q3 2025, Thiel Macro initiated new positions in Microsoft and Apple, which accounted for 34% and 27% of its portfolio, respectively. Thiel views Microsoft as a "builder" in AI and Apple as having a large AI distribution network.

**Elon Musk (Prominent Investor)**
*   As noted above, through Tesla, an investment of $2 billion was made in xAI.
*   Through SpaceX, the acquisition of xAI created a combined entity valued at $1.25 trillion, aiming to develop space-based data centers for AI compute.

### III. Single-Stock 2x Leveraged ETFs

Based on recent filings and launches, here is a table of 2x leveraged single-stock ETFs that have either launched in the last 30 days (January 27, 2026 - February 26, 2026) or are filed to launch in the next 3 weeks (February 27, 2026 - March 19, 2026).

| Underlying Ticker | New ETF Ticker | Leverage Ratio | Issuer     | Launch/Effective Date |
| :---------------- | :------------- | :------------- | :--------- | :-------------------- |
| AXP               | AXPG           | 2x             | Leverage Shares | February 19, 2026 |

**Note on Data Collection for ETFs:** Identifying all filings for the precise future 3-week window or detailed information for all recent launches can be challenging without direct, real-time access to SEC filing databases filtered by specific criteria (single-stock, 2x leveraged, launch/effective dates). The provided searches identified one specific recent launch fitting the criteria. Other existing 2x single-stock leveraged ETFs mentioned in the search results include:

*   Direxion Daily TSLA Bull 2X Shares (TSLL)
*   GraniteShares 2x Long NVDA Daily ETF (NVDL)
*   Direxion Daily ASML Bull 2X ETF (ASML)
*   Direxion Daily BABA Bull 2X ETF (BABA)
*   Direxion Daily SOFI Bull 2X ETF (SOFI)
*   Direxion Daily MRVL Bull 2X ETF (MRVL)
*   T-REX 2X Leveraged ETFs (e.g., FGRU for FIGR, APHU for APH)
*   FBL - 2x Leveraged Meta Stock ETF (META)

These listed ETFs are existing products rather than new launches or filings within the specified narrow window, apart from AXPG.
